abstract: Boy Scouts of America ends ban on openly gay adult leaders, but will still allow church-sponsored units to use their own precepts to choose leaders; Church of Latter-day Saints announces its objection to change in policy and says it may still leave organization, which raises possibility that other religious groups, such as Roman Catholic Church, may follow suit.
lead_paragraph: The change will head off looming discrimination lawsuits but will still allow church-based units to exclude gay adults. The Mormon Church, the country’s largest sponsor of Scout units, said it might leave.

headline.main: Boy Scouts End Ban on Gay Leaders, Over Protests by Mormon Church
headline.print_headline: Mormons Assail Boy Scouts’ Shift on Gay Leaders
